comment._content:
Wonderful to see this recent photo of the church. It looks just the same, even the gateway and the stone fence. Except the season of course.. :)  

I have added the information of the church name St. Magdalene.
Thanks for posting!

/Anna B.

comment.author: 27236408@N00
comment._content:
There are mistakes in the title of the picture and in the description (twice "Rhunu" and once "Runhu").
It's the first time I used machine tags for the location, how will the picture become visible on the map? Do you have to approve the coordinates somehow?

comment.author: 27236408@N00
comment._content: It's supposedly the oldest wooden building in the Baltic countries. More views.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
I placed it on the map manually. Today, there are, as far as I know, no  good way for users to Geotag the photos on Flickr. Does anyone know more?

/Johan C

comment.author: 27236408@N00
comment._content: Actually there is Suggestify, but I don't know how much it's used. Seems that some of the pictures from the Powerhouse Museum have got geotagged with the app. And also Brooklyn Museum is asking people to use it (one example not yet geotagged). So you might try use it, I suppose.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Vahur Puik: Thanks for the tip on Suggestify - we'll check it out.

Great you noticed our spelling slips, now corrected thanks to you :) And thanks for the link to more modern photos - very interesting to see the beautiful interior. I especially liked the pews!

/Anna B.
